Message.Title: Note to Jeff on the Newspaper
Message.Msg: The newspaper thing still bothers me. I would have bought off if Amazon would have bought it. You could have said Amazon bought it for the content. But Amazon didnt buy it. You did. For your sake, and of course for the shareholders, I hope Amazon shows a profit before the newspaper does.

Topic.Title: if mafia won't pump spx above 1652 level by next Tuesday

Message.Msg: I reemember when I was 12 years old. I was obsessed with equlity and commodity. Every morning the first thing I cheked was stocks, commodies like gold, orange, pork belly's future on newspaper. (No Internet then.) And more than often I can predict future movement correctly so my father constantly asked for my opinions and he made tons of money using my prediction. Later I am surprised how much he made. My dad was a professor in the school of business in a major university.

Message.Title: PSDV (MC $80 M) PDUFA Date on October 17 for Blockbuster Drug + Low Float = 500%++ Potential !!!
Message.Msg: This Low Float Stock has the Potential to hit $6++ before FDA decision on October 17 and could move into double digits easily with FDA approval for Blockbuster Candidate Iluvien .There is NO FDA approved drugs for DME (Diabetic Macular Edema) . Upon US approval of Iluvien, pSivida would be entitled to receive a $25 million milestone payment from Alimera and 20 percent of net profits, as defined, on sales of the drug by Alimera. Pfizer is third largest Shareholder of PSDV holding 1.9 M Shares . PSDV is very close to profitability . Psivida (PSDV) Market Cap: $81 M Cash: $24 M Price: $3.50 Shares Out: 26.8 M ( 10.4 M shares held by Insiders & Institutions) “We are very pleased that the FDA has accepted Alimera Sciences’ recently resubmitted New Drug Application for ILUVIEN® for chronic Diabetic Macular Edema (DME) and has set a PDUFA target date of October 17, 2013." Upon US approval of Iluvien, pSivida would be entitled to receive a $25 million milestone payment from Alimera and 20 percent of net profits, as defined, on sales of the drug by Alimera. DME is a potentially blinding disease that affects over one million people in the United States. Currently there are no FDA approved drugs for the treatment of DME.The U.S. market for DME is $1.5 billion to $4 billion. --

Message.Title: Subterfuge
Message.Msg: I am very bothered by Amazons use of Media. The lines of truth are blurred with all the pumping articles they put out through Business Insider[every article on Amazon should come with the caveat that Amazon has a financial position in this Rag], Motley Fool, etc..Now Bezos owns The Post. Does anyone think he won't surreptitiously use this vehicle for economic aggrandizement. I guess we should consider all "News" now as equivalent to throw away advertising we get in the mail. No volume, manipulated, no earnings, fantasy camp Stock price.

Topic.Title: i am killing it on nflx an amzn

Message.Msg: Please. This stock was pegged as being tired by multiple technicians not long after it made it's highs and very much to their credit Nas6000 and brucetheharmicaguy, two long time bulls, sold a few dollars away from the top. They'll be back when they feel the time and conditions are right. I'm sure you also know that markets don't go straight up like they have this year so your idea about lucking out is utter nonsense. Tired markets often look for a reason to correct, although they didn't have to look far today.

Topic.Title: Subterfuge

Message.Msg: This has been going on forever. Motley Fool is right up there on the list but I have seen 1 or 2 writers there come out with bearish material. They will probably no longer exist at Motley Fool soon. usually the articles say nearly nothing, lots of bells and whistles but no substance. Hmmmm, sounds just like Amazon's conference calls, ".... we have our heads down.......... We continue to invest in the future" Bvllshit. Come on sell side analysts call a spade a spade. The metrics have been worsening for years now and not a peep out of them.

Message.Msg: Assad may unleash chemical weapons not only on the rebels, but may also rain rockets, missiles and even chemical weapons on Israel and Saudi. Message.Title: Can't Get Over It
Message.Msg: I just can't stop thinking about the day a month ago, which was the first trading day after the bad earnings release and negative guidance. The stock opened down about 12, and I felt ok as a short, although I had predicted down 20. Then it turned around and minute by minute rose to green and finished up almost 10 on the day. I sat there dumbfounded watching the whole thing wondering WHO THE HELL WAS BUYING THIS AT THESE LEVELS AND WHY? Of course, I love seeing these people get pounded to oblivion in the intervening month, but still can't help wonder WHAT WERE THEY THINKING? And how do people who buy like that even have money? I guess that's just one of those mysteries of the universe I'll never understand. Anyway, back to reality........
